alert.note: Alert for Nowata; Osage; Pawnee; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 22 at 9:22AM CST until December 22 at 10:15AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Osage County in northeastern Oklahoma... Washington County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Nowata County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Pawnee County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 1015 AM CST. * At 919 AM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 3 miles south of Howard to 7 miles north of Grainola to 4 miles west of Geuda Springs, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * Highway 75 between Ramona and the Kansas state line will be impacted. Locations impacted include... Bartlesville, Pawhuska, Dewey, Fairfax, Barnsdall, South Coffeyville, Copan, Ramona, Shidler, Wynona, Ochelata, Delaware, Ralston, Avant, Lenapah, Burbank, Wann, Grainola, Foraker and Bigheart. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
